review: I came here to pick up an order last night. For some weird reason the bar tender is also the guy who gets your carry out order. Unfortunately for me, he had just started fulfilling a sizable drink order. I had to wait about 10 minutes for my order. I got an extra order of home fries in a cup and I wasn't sure if this was standard or to in some way compensate me for my time. Either way, it was all good. I had the Banzai salad which was good, thank goodness the dressing was on the side. My dinner companion had a burger and made yummy noises the whole time she ate. Red Robin Towson is A-OK and we will probably be back since it's in the 'hood.

I haven't been here for almost a year.... The burger is on point ....As good as Bobby Flay... Plus the service was excellent .... Food came out quick and was able to pay via a tablet on the table... Great family spot too...kids can be loud
They have the best turkey burgers in the world! Guest can't beat the price either. I paid $9.99 for my meal, which included endless fries.

This was my first time at this location in over two years. The menu now includes more food option which is great. I was very disappointed that they were out of soft drink. Staff stated that it was due to Veterans Day celebration. Minus the lack of drink options my experience was overall pleasant. The food was good and inexpensive although prices have increased.

I'm not a fan of Red Robin. It's more of a family oriented or kiddy kind of place in my opinion. Burgers are very basic. I don't want to sit in a burger restaurant and have basic. think if you only sell burgers they should be real handmade in the kitchen kind of burgers.  I ended up here after seeing the ad for the Billion Dollar Baby burger. Winner of the South Beach Wine and Food Festival for 2016.  Now more about this burger, angus beef on a roasted ciabatta bun, peppered bacon, fried potato cake,truffle flavored cheese blend, fontina cheese, mayo, shredded romaine and grilled tomatoes.  Sounds like burger heaven right? It was.  Service was decent. Bartender was attentive.  Margaritas are 5.50 all day.I like the machine that lets you pay your bill at your table. Which is a plus. Pretty convenient if you are in a hurry.  If I had to take my god children somewhere to eat. This would be it. If I needed to eat, this isn't it .I'm a foodie, if I visit a place like this. I need a burger or an item similar to this on the menu for me to return.

Guacamole burger looked like guacamole had maybe been smeered on the bun and then scraped back off. Then the waiter upcharged us on fries that he had said earlier came with the burger. I heard another waitress say something about veterans discounts, so I asked our waiter and he said yeah, but not on anything we had ordered. Would have been good to know earlier. Really disappointing experience.

THIS REVIEW IS JUST FOR THE NEW SALMON BURGER ON THE MENU---- It is excellent, amazing, delicious, well-cooked, and something that I would never expect to enjoy from Red Robin. The cut of salmon was very generous, the flavor was on point, and the bottomless fries on the side added to the number. I typically don't care for burgers from here because the toppings are the only thing gourmet about them, but this salmon burger was gourmet all the way. My only advice is to hold the tempura lemon wheels as a topping. They were actually disgusting!

Why am I reviewing a sub-par burger chain? Because their 'gourmet' burgers are overpriced, poor quality crap.  And I hate being duped, and so should you.   We had their pepper bacon burger, which came out tepid. The quality of meat was poor as evidenced by the grainy filler texture, and the overly crisp, and THIN, barely-there 1  1/2 slices of bacon, were the grand insult for a burger that tops $13 bucks. Bottomless fries? Is that a draw for people?  How many fries can a person eat, anyway?  We had to wait around for 15 minutes to get more, and by that time we just wanted to leave to go eat somewhere good.   For a better burger experience all-round and for half the price, try Five Guys.  Their burgers are always fresh, HOT, and delicious! I won't bother to mention the hostess..oh wait maybe I will.  She was a surly thing, with more eyelash than personality...barely acknowledged us as we entered the restaurant, and definitely couldn't care less-you know the type-thinks she too good to be working at a sub-par burger joint....Well, maybe if she gets her meals there, then I can understand the attitude....
The good: Ten minute wait to get a table The ugly: 30 minute wait and no menu or no waiter!  See ya!

This location is a thousand times better than White Marsh. Though RR is not my personal favorite, my kids and niece always always request it when given a choice. The service was a lot quicker and friendlier, even though they were crowded and busy. The manager also checked in to make sure everything was okay. They also seem to have a team atmosphere where servers help each other with food and drinks when it's in the best interest of the customers. The bathrooms and restaurant were very clean. I couldn't give a five because the food isn't my favorite (for example our nachos were dripping with grease), but if I have to go to one this is the best Baltimore choice.

I used to like this place but during our last family visit, I sat at that table for two hours watching while some of our orders came out in fits and dribbles.  We arrived at 7, and my brother-in-law left at 8:15 without having eaten.  The two side salads were the substitute-for-fries salads, and the person who ordered sweet potato fries didn't get them (which is normal).  Me and two others were still waiting for food when we decided to leave at 9:15.  A manager came to the table at one point, but seemed completely oblivious to there being a problem.  I contacted Red Robin customer service, but am still waiting for a reply, two-and-a-half weeks later.     This location looks like it's ready to close, and has lost my business.

Service was awful, noisy and food was mediocre. The waitress took a very long rime to take our order and an even longer time providing us with the check. In fact, we waited so long we decided to pay by using the electronic device on the table. I had asked the waitress for a box, she never returned, I had to go to the kitchen to ask for one. I will never eat here again.

Service has gone down hill with this restaurant. Had to ask for my child's milk twice after a 10 min wait for it. It was empty at the time(7tables). Food was average. You're not missing much with all of the other options in the area.

This is a great place to eat and the tablet on the table is my mom and my son's favorite, they play games together and enjoy great food.  They have good burgers but my favorite is the prime rib dip.  The fries are good and endless so you won't leave hungry.
The service was really good. The Avo-Cobb salad was amazing. I would come back just for the salad. The sweet potato fries were cooked well, but we're not seasoned at all.
The service was great. The food was out to me nice & hot. My waitress constantly checked to make sure I was good

Even though I only gave 3 stars, I'll admit this was a guilty pleasure of mine.  Bottomless fries?  Yea, I'll take that! And the burgers...damn good for a chain.  Until you find out that they are a gajillion calories.   Thanks, but I'd like to stave off my heart attack for a few more years.   Red Robin IS yummmmm.   Just don't make the mistake of whipping out your calorie counter app!

There check in system didn't work so the hostess looked retarded calling out namesake nobody was moving and the waiting area was packed. After we got seated had to asked our waiter to clean the booth. Looked like they just wipes everything from the table on the seats. Asked for a bottle less root beer float but had to wait for the ice cream to freeze (waiter's exact words). Had to send plates back cause they were dirty. Server was polite though. My family and I eat at the other Red Robin by our house and they are awesome. Never coming to this one again

This was the location that popped my RR cherry many years ago so it has a specially place in my belly.  I am a burger snob so I don't get beef when I go to any RR because I have another spot in which I like beef burgers from. When I go to RR I get a turkey or veggie patty.  My usual is the whiskey river burger with a turkey patty, yum.  I like RR because of be bottomless fries and many choices of burgers. It's fair priced and the service is usually good.

I have eaten at this Red Robin a ton of times and usually have a good experience... The PROs -veggie burger options are good -black & blue setup w/ veggie burger is super good -onion ring stack is good! -spinach dip is good -pretzel bites are pretty good -fish and chips is good -rewards members get a freebie each month -open kitchen -men's bathroom is usually clean -wait service is usually friendly and pretty good -flavored lemonades and teas are good -bottomless steak fries -big parking lot area The CONs -sometimes they have a ton of tables open and will make you wait -only once did we have an issue where there was no blue cheese on the  burger, but they quickly remade it -not enough seating in lobby for waiting customers Overall I'm a fan of Red Robin. I've been to other locations and I seem to always get consistency. I'm not a fan of chain restaurants, but I will go to Red Robin!

Food is OK here, they always seem to mess up something with my order that other RR locations don't. The servers are really friendly and offer great service but it's just not worth the MEH food and filthy place. The bathrooms were one of the worst i've ever seen anywhere, let alone a restaurant. The entire dining area is always dirty constantly. I'd recommend just going to the white marsh location if you want red robin. It's out of the way, but it's worth it when it comes to the let down of this location

I must admit that I've been to this location in the past and the White Marsh one as well and have had good experiences. Only wish I could say the same about today's visit. My friend and I arrived around 3pm for a late lunch. There were maybe 10 tables filled at any one time. My friend was craving their onion rings and was told they were sold out. Our server said Valentine's Day "did them in." I'm sorry but Valentines Day was 6 days ago. What, no food deliveries in 6 days? Not her fault but still unacceptable. I ordered a side salad and my friend chose the mozzarella sticks. She enjoyed hers. The salad was just meh. Typical side salad, however it arrived without dressing. Another person dumped it in front of me and abruptly turned on her heels to return to the kitchen. I had to call out to get her attention to please bring the salad dressing. After another 5 minutes, she returned. The waitress eventually returned to take the rest of our order. Our appetizer and salad plates were not removed until our meal arrived. My friend ordered pickles with her burger and when it was delivered was told they were out of pickles! My gosh, there's a grocery store located in the same shopping center for pete's sake! Again, not the server's fault. I ordered mayo on the side... guess what? You got it... not there. I had to ask and wait for another 5 minutes for it to arrive. The fries were cold, my friends burger was hot. Mine was barely warm after waiting for the mayo. The LT and onion were just sad. One small pic of lettuce, 2 VERY thin slices of tomato and literally 4 thin slices of red onion for the entire burger. I only ate half bc it was so salty and my friend said her was completely tasteless. The manager asked us how our meal was and when expressed our concerns he said we were really busy yesterday. I told him he should go to Weiss for some pickles, half joking. He replied I did but they went through them already. Mister go buy more or learn how to order your food. I will return to Red Robin but not this location.

I come here for the fries! I mean can you blame me? Who else is giving you endless amounts of, not just fries, but steak fries? C'mon its french fry heaven! I could stop my review here, but I guess I'll talk about the burgers too. I've never had anything other than a burger because if a place is known for its burgers im surely not going to order a salad! I've had the A1 Peppercorn, Royal Red Robin, Whiskey River BBQ, and Burnin Love. The latter was my favorite; with pepper jack cheese, chipotle aioli, and fried jalapenos its perfectly spicy. The service on my last visit (11/15/14) was sub par, but that's not the norm so a solid burger joint.

Friendly service. A party of 5 and some food came out before others and brang out and order of regular fries when sweet potato fries were requested. Food was average. Not fond of the table top tablets that you can use to purchase games. My 5 year old got a hold of it and was charged for a game that he hit start for but i quickly noticed and ended. It was taken off the bill but dont like that there is no parental control to avoid any accidental purchases. Not sure if I will return to this location, was not a truly memorable experience.
Terrible experience. Ordered appetizers that never came. Terrible service. My daughters dinner came 20 minutes before the rest of our food. Manager did nothing to help the situation. Poorly managed.

Quick service. Friendly staff. Delicious burgers. I love their garlic fries at other locations. These were mostly grease and very overdone. Asked for new fries twice. Waitress was accommodating but they still came out poorly all three times.

My husband and I went on a Saturday around 2p, so a little after the lunch rush. We were seated immediately in the bar section and greeted by our friendly server, Natty.  We had a decent sized booth for just the two of us, we got an appetizer, beer, and split a whiskey river BBQ salad. The appetizer, towering onion rings, is one of my a favorites. And we followed that up with the salad, split between the two of us. Perfect amount of food to fill us up. The onion rings came out very quick, they were hot and tasty!  Salad was delicious and I took the rest of mine home as leftovers. The place was clean, the food was delivered by two different people, both very friendly. And the hostess that sat us was friendly as well. The place is good for kids and groups ... I don't think they take reservations though - but if you have a large party, I would recommend calling ahead so they can get the tables together.  All time favorite is still the Whiskey River BBQ chicken burger, bottomless fries, with a side of (amazing) honey mustard poppyseed dressing. I've been to Red Robin in Owings Mills/Towson several times, and it's nice to see that over the years the food continues to come out exactly the same. Every now and then there are specials (I think there's a delicious burger that comes out around October) - but I can always count on the meal looking and tasting like it did the last time. The menus used to be a tall laminated thing, now they have rearranged and made the menu into a booklet. No difference to me.. as long as the pages aren't sticky.  Strawberry lemonade..... MUST try if you have a sweet tooth.

Red Robin, Red Robin. You used to be amazing, so amazing. But these last few visits have been a grave disappointment. Every time it's like they've found a new trick to cut corners. The quantity of the spinach and artichoke dip appetizer has diminished noticeably at each visit it the last year or so, until my most recent visit where the portion was comically small, in a dish approximately the size of a large ramekin, and only filled halfway. It also tasted like the frozen dip you can get at the supermarket. Likewise, the burgers have shrunk. They try to trick you by using a large bun, but the quantity of meat is definitely less. They also give you less fries, and although they are still bottomless, they make sure to never ask if you want more. They must have some sort of policy like, don't remind the customers about the fries! so you have to actively seek out a server and request your extra fries, which makes you feel like maybe you shouldn't have more fries. I also ordered a salad there recently and it was way too small for a fairly expensive price. All the prices seem inflated for the food quantity.  They recently did some sort of image overhaul where they redid the menu and added a lot of options. The burgers are still delicious (whiskey river BBQ burger is the best!) But I think I can probably find a comparable restaurant where you don't feeling like you're being cheated. I think I'm done. Quit being so cheap, Red Robin. Very disappointed.

I've eaten here twice; the first time was fine. I got a patty melt that was good and everything went smoothly The second time we came was pretty awful. There was just a lot of literal garbage on and around our table (wrappers and crumbs and stuff like that) and we aren't usually a nitpicky group... It was just crazy how much garbage there was lol. Our server was terribly inattentive and didn't refill things even though there weren't really any other people in the restaurant. We think that the service was bad because we came in at a weird hour (like mid afternoon, probably around when the high school gets out) and maybe the servers don't give a damn around then because they are used to being shafted by kids? I dunno. My burger was small and gross, like falling apart and mushy, I forget exactly what I ordered but it had guacamole on it.

We are fairly regular visitors to this Red Robin but I felt compelled to leave a review after our last experience. We found PLASTIC in my daughter's french onion soup. My wife's Chicken Tortilla soup was cold with congealed cheese stranded upon the top. My son's mini corn dogs were plump with hot dog and the tavern double was solid per usual.  The manager was quick to apologize for the plastic but the damage was done. No amount of bottomless fries could make up for the experience. We have a gift card so we will be back, but this time just for milkshakes.

Ok. Here we go.  It took 10 minutes to get my order in. And another 14 to get me the Red Robin with egg burger. The Burger was a 3 star only, akl the hipe about the meat beeng antibiotic fre and bla bla bla. Did not make it taste any better than 5 guys, acctualy I rather have a 5 guys burger now. We where never asked if we wanted more fries. They are supposed to bottomless. Ho well.  Only 3 stars not impressed. Maybe when hungry after Christmas shopping next year we may have to stop in before we drop on the floor.

It's been 3 years since my last visit. Service was slow but it was 1pm on Dec 31. My side salad showed up with an avocado shell/skin, but the salad has no avocado in it. I suspect it came from someone else's plate that did not eat it. Saw another server near us drinking a root beer float. Also saw a cook come from the back with his pants below his ass. Red Robin....Yuck!

After 1 disappointing experience with 1 specific server (not the food, just the server), we ended up speaking to a supervisor at the branch who sent us a gift card for $25 so we could give them a second try.  We just recently went back, and the experience was much better. I applaud Red Robin for recognizing the issue, apologizing, and doing everything in their power to remedy it.

Four stars for being good and doing things right - the fifth is for exceptional service. The waitress didn't nag us as we carefully went over the menu. When we were finally ready, she quickly took our order, and then promptly brought our pretzel bites and my vodka beverage thingie. The food came out in a decent time frame, and our waitress was ever-attentive, coming back to ask if everything was all right, or if we needed anything (refills, etc), but not to the point of nagging like some waitstaff can be.

Nothing too special but the food was decent, and I'm sure the same food that you would get at any other Red Robin! We came on a Saturday night and even at 8 pm it was pretty crowded!!  We had to wait 10 minutes for a table, ordered right away, and then waited probably another 30 minutes for our food. My only issue was that I asked for no mayo on my burger and it still came with mayo :o(  So even though I was STARVING I had to spend the first 5 minutes after getting my food scraping the mayo off of the top and the bottom bun of my burger. You can also ask for some fixings for FREE!  Like I asked for some red onions for my burger and they came free of charge. I ordered the turkey burger (... with no mayo...) and I got a side salad instead of the bottomless steak fries.  You can get a bottomless side salad OR bottomless steamed broccoli to substitue for your fries if you're feeling healthy, which I think is a great option!

I love red robin... This location never disappoints. I got a regular burger with the delicious bottomless fries. My nieces had the kids' pasta and grilled cheese... No leftovers there! The new feature that I really enjoyed was the tablet... For $5 you get limitless games. We had a great time playing trivia while waiting for our food. I was also able to pay the bill on the tablet.. No waiting for the waitress to come back over.

I entered this establishment having only the highest expectations for my dining experience. However, my expectations were quickly lowered when I looked around and saw silverware as well as trash littered amongst the floor. My waitress was very attentive, which might just have been the saving grace of this restaurant. My cheese fries were covered with cheese slices that weren't even completely melted, but the taste wasn't completely horrid. My disappointment continued when my burger arrived. It was small and ultimately disappointing. As a burger establishment, I expected more from them. Finally my dessert was missing it's berry sauce which is an advertised element so I can not imagine why it was not present on my dish. Overall I was not pleased with my experience. I would not recommend to anyone in the near future.

My son and I ate here for the first time Saturday night. I have never been to a restaurant that had a security guard in it, so that there told me that must be some very rowdy people that patron this location. Our food was very good, the waitess was super nice, but the young couple sitting next to us was very loud, obnoxious.and annoying. My son and I could hear their whole conversation.
This place had a weird smell, and everything from the fryer had a strange chemical taste.  The clueless waiter didn't care to do anything about the barely edible (unsafe?) food.

Looking for a great restaurant with "Gluten Free" options? Look no further, Red Robin is one of the few large chain restaurants providing an inclusive dinning out experience for those with gluten intolerance, and for those searching for a healthier lifestyle.  Red Robin provides gluten free buns so now you too can enjoy a mouthwatering, gourmet burger! Not sure what burger to choose? I highly recommend the "Banzai Burger." Marinated in teriyaki, and on top of all of your favorite burger toppings is a sweet, delicious pineapple. Oh, and don't worry, the gluten free bun is just as good. It's moist, not dry and has some flavor. Certainly the best I've ever had!

Have been going here for years, good chili burgers, like the fries, if you get there to far after 6pm you may have to wait. located across from Petsmart & Target, so we usually get couple of errands done in the process as well. A good spot to add to your dinning out repertoire.
This was pretty good. I have been to better Red Robins. The fries were hard or a little too crispy. The server was great. I'd go back.

Why are my burgers always cold here? Look, Red Robin, I know you make up your burgers ahead of time and keep them in warm water heated by heat lamps, but maybe turn up the temperature a tad?  Otherwise, good fries, and pretty chipper staff (half of whom are named Meghan or Jennifer).   It could be a little cleaner: Please Red Robin, learn to sweep under the table, wipe off the grease from the ketchup and pepper shakers as part of your cleaning up process! Lastly-and this seems to be on par with other "family oriented" restaurants these days-since parents do not know how to control their lovely children anymore, and babysitters are all starving for work, expect NOISE; the music and TVs are too loud, kids shout and scream to be heard and noticed, and I'm yelling at Meghan and Jennifer to request more fries!  ~Makes Five Guys seem like a Zen experience!
Being a vegetarian, I love the fact that Red Robin will allow you to substitute any burger with a veggie burger.  Take-out service is great and packaged nicely for the ride home.

The food here is very basic for any chain. Though it's nice to get bottomless steak fries with your burger which increases the value. Service is rather inconsistent. Some waiters/waitresses are amazing, others ignore you and look like they hate their job. Probably depends on the time of day you come in. Later at night seems to be the busier, but better serving time. I've probably had better burgers in my life but these certainly aren't the worst either. I'd classify my experiences here as just "very average" nothing to flip your lid, but good average food for the price.

My boyfriend and I went to Red Robbin last night. There were multiple issues and it was a Tuesday night so, we thought that they were slow enough that they shouldn't have those issues. The manager came over and apologized and took the Item off our check because there was something wrong with it. After that, we ordered a side of onion rings which I ended up canceling because it took to long. Mary, the manager came over with the onion rings and said the check was on her that night. It was a huge surprise and we really appreciated it. Needless to say after all the mess ups, we will defiantly be back again!

Been here at least a dozen times...there are always the usual ups and downs depending on what time, who your server, etc. Overall, it seems to be getting better. Just love red robbins.  My favorite is the royal red robbin burger, try the egg and you'll never go back.  You can also add an egg to any other burgers, my favorite is the A1 peppercorn with an egg to really splurge. : )

My friends and I visit the place often to satisfy our craving for a luscious, fatty burger. They have a decent selection of burgers, though their beer selection is poor: mainstream light beers or non-carbonated Guinness (that is a poor match for a greasy burger). Their waitresses are friendly, though you will probably wait 10 to 15 minutes if you go during standard meal time. You get free fries refill as well. Personally, I always get guacamole bacon burger, but most of my friends are obsessed about the chili burger (get it if you're okay with eating your burger with a fork and a knife). TIP: their menu doesn't explicitly say it, but you can MONSTER-size any burger.  Suggestion: if you're a fan of burgers, you won't be disappointed.

I'm lucky enough to live just blocks from this Red Robin. We've made this our "go to place" when friends and/or family comes.  It's a very accommodating restaurant to our three kids ages 6, 4, and 18 months (at the time of this review of course...). There is very diverse crowd, all the time but a lot of families as the restaurant is located just outside of a large neighborhood with lots of families. My favorite burger is the Whiskey River BBQ and the A1 Peppercorn. My wife's is the shroom but veggie style.  Only a couple times have we had any issues and it was the same issue twice. My salad wasn't brought out until my meal came...big pet-peeve.  End the end of the evening we're walking out with full stomachs, happy palates, and balloons in hand.

It depends. Sometimes when it is busy (Friday night, any weekend night), you might wait for your food to be delivered forever. So just keep that in mind. Burgers are great though, so are the appetizers (we love clam strips and onion rings). Drinks are delicious, milkshakes are great (if you like milkshakes, go for the endless refill, they will bring you a tin cup with another shake, it is just like buying two for the price of one). Bring some Tabasco sauce with you for burgers, I am not sure they have hot sauce available by request. It gets noisy there and there are a lot of kids (excellent place to take them!), but all in all the food is pretty good, service is great and we just keep coming back!

On a Friday night, there is a wait, like every other place, but overall a pretty decent chain type restaurant.  Service is pretty solid.  The only thing I would say is that we have frequented other Red Robins and we usually order the Whiskey River Wrap.  At this Red Robin, the chicken was cold.  Usually, at other Red Robins it is warm.  We also had the mushroom swiss burger which was cooked exactly how we asked, so this place is a solid 3 star...
We generally have good service here. They are really great with kids. Come early -- the wait starts around 6pm. Can be very loud depending on where you sit!

Treat lunch for kid after next-to-last day of school.  It is a chain restaurant with basic sandwiches and fries.  Decor is colorful with interesting art and objects to check out while you wait. Its family friendly with a small arcade area and free balloons for kids.  Good shakes.  My chicken sandwich was very lackluster today.  They offer free refills on fries, but my family has never finished our firsts.

it's a chain but who can beat bottomless steak fries? we made this our I'm too lazy to cook on Sunday place. I love the chicken tenders in buffalo sauce and the burgers are pretty good too esp the Whiskey River BBQ (it also comes as a chicken sandwich too). It's your avg american style food, but like i said, Bottomless Fries. It's a good place to take kids and the wait can be a while but  I still like this place

went there today at 3pm. not crowded, service quick. bottomless fries a true statement. problem is the 3 times we got them they were luke warm.i only like hot fries. maybe they weren't hot due to lack of crowd or maybe they make  a big batch and keep them warm with a lamp, either way temperature and freshness lack big time. 3rd time there in 5 years. don't really care for the place. should have gone to ruby Tuesday in Essex.

The waitress (Kasey) was great - awesome service and attentive.  We had the Game day nachos (new) and the only thing that would have made them perfect is no seeds on the sliced jalepenos.  Had the "burnin' love" burger and was EXCELLENT!  I highly recommend this location.

Wow where do I begin? it all began with a call to the local RedRobyn for a pick up order ( we have 3 small kids ). My wife started of the call saying she wanted a well done burger the lady said no bun my wife said well done needless  to say we received a burger with no bun yum ! The burgers were cooked well done to well done in fact they were burnt to a crisp it tasted like they were in a three alarm fire ( funny though they were actually pretty cold I only live five minutes away).My buzzard wings  were served cold as well ,sauce  on the side like I requested but not buzzard hot wing sauce but more like a sweet and sour sauce yuk . My order of mozzarella sticks were not cooked all the way  another disappointment ;0(  The only thing they got right was my children's chicken tender meals ( at least they got a good meal) next time I will be saving my self  quite a few a bucks and head to Burger King !!!!!

Not bad for a chain restaurant (meaning all the cook does is defrost/microwave prepackaged meals). I try to avoid places like this but the service has always been excellent. The staff does not seem to like the manager much and they do anything possible to piss him off. Last time I went they asked me to to tell him I found a pubic hair in my beer (which i did) and i got free stuff out of the deal!  If you have kids, this place is for you. There are a ton of them every time I go. If you don't have kids, go to the bar and get served. You won't hear anything but the bartender and the TV.

TERRIBLE, terrible, terrible!!!!   First, the place was very crowded (the waiting area-not the actual restaurant) and the hostess didn't take our names (I did offer it) when asking how many for lunch.  So after 10 minutes, she starts calling our names and I reminded her she didn't take my name and miraculously we were next.  We waited another 10 minutes before the waitress came by.  Once our order was placed-just burgers-it was nearly 30 minutes before our meals arrived.  I could have gotten the same burger at McDonald's and my dining partners burger (the special Octoberfest burger) looked NOTHING like its rendering on paper.  Both meals were poorly put together and the side salads we got in lieu of fries were nearly non-edible.  I mean, how long can a burger and a side salad take?? The burgers didn't taste horrible....but we were also starving. The waitress was pleasant enough, but management has obviously not taught wait staff about coasters, or checking on customers during the meal.   I will never EVER go back to that or any Red Robin and i suggest you do the same.

Excellent service! Heather was  great! Food was great....my son said the A-1 burger was the best he ever had! I had a patty melt which was very good and my husband loved the Royal Robin burger. Also the Irish beer shake was quite tasty.  Only complaint - the bathroom needed some fixing. I mentioned to the server and she said they would take care of it.

Got takeout from Red Robin and was pleasantly surprised. The burgers are actually quite good for a casual chain restaurant. Good size, a lot of creative toppings, and the buns are just dense enough to keep the whole thing together. No, this isn't gourmet and the various styles of burgers are probably better classified as lots of sauce and lots of fats (you know that "chain restaurant flavor" usually most identifiable at Applebee's), but sometimes that's exactly why a burger is the perfect chain restaurant food. If you want fresh veggie toppings or some sort of lightly applied aioli, you probably shouldn't be eating a burger. Oh, and the steak house style fries are a great touch!

2.5 stars Some of the burgers and entrees were decent when this Red Robin opened, but everything has since plateaued into a painfully average dining experience. Sometimes burgers arrive undercooked. This has never happened to me anywhere else, and it should *not* happen at a place where burgers are the stars of the show.

Red Robin is the most vegetarian friendly chain restaurant I know of. A surprise I know for a burger joint. You can get every burger on their menu with a choice of two veggie patties, both boca and the garden burger variety. I tend to prefer the boca patty and go for choices like the whiskey river, blue ribbon, blackened bayou, and most recently the pub style.  Their beer selection has much to be desired, but a yummy treat is their freckled lemonade.  Its worth visiting their flash calorie counter when planning meals, since some of their burger/fry combos run upwards of 1500 calories. Ouch! I tend to go for a subbed wheat bun, a side salad instead of fries, and only eat half. One of the benefits of red robin is the extraordinarily fast service.  This seems to stay true for the chain around the country. You can be in, seated, fed, and checked out within 30 minutes. Overall a good choice for a fast and satisfying veggie burger.

First time being in this Red Robin as I've been to two other locations.  I came here at 11:15AM after a meeting I had down the street.  It wasn't busy and the only loud noise was coming from the music they had blasting.   Ordered my go-to Shroom Burger with a Fried Egg cooked medium.  Came out great.  Lots of mushrooms and onions.  Egg yolk was nice and runny.  The food was up to par, but the service was a little harsh to me.   The server seemed like she was trying to be nice in that fake kind of way, almost like she had an attitude but was kind about it.  I don't know if I'm making any sense.  Maybe it was because she was very short and blunt in the way she was communicating.  She'd explain herself after checking in with us as if she was self aware of the way she was acting so in her explaining, she's justifying as to why she's saying things the way she is.  Definitely had better service than this at other Red Robins.

A really bad experience here tonight. Most of the food was cold, the grilled cheese for my grandson was burnt, and there was no apology from the manager. The waitress, however, worked really hard to take care of us. We will not going back.  Hope the waitress finds a better job. She deserves it.

We love Red Robin and eat there a lot.  However, we left this location without ordering anything.  First of all it was 5:30 p.m. on a Thursday evening.  The seating area was EMPTY but the waiting area was full.  They weren't seating anyone.  The 2 girls taking names would not give an approximate wait time and wouldn't tell us why they weren't seating anyone.  We waited for over 15 minutes along with 5 other families and the hostess girls were rude and would not speak to anyone and acted like they did not want to be there.  My daughter and I went to the restroom and caught a male employee his girlfriend coming out of the women's restroom and acting as if we just caught them doing something.  After that we just left.  We figured if it was that sketchy we weren't going to wait and see how long it took us to get seated and fed.  I'm not paying for that kind of service.  There are too many options these days.  You need to bring your A game if you want my money.

If I could give no stars I would!!!!!!! Went here last night with my brother and children. I must say I was disappointed again! I went to a Red Robin two almost three years ago in a another city, in a another state. After that horrible visit I promised I would NEVER visit another Red Robin again. I should've just stuck with that and Not went but after seeing the bottomless fries commercial over and over and over again I was now craving the fries! So I took my family. Our service started off HORRIBLE, It took us 5-10 minutes to get seated and the sad part is, they weren't that busy or understaffed and we were the only ones that walked in. After we were seated it took more than 20 minutes to have our server greet us and introduce her self to us! I wasn't happy about that our service started off horrible! That strawberry lemonade they have is disgusting and they should stop serving it but to each it's own! I ordered our appetizers and it took a minute for us to order them because the server kept walking past us and not tending to us at all to be honest! It was more so like "oh I forgot I have those customers too", We didn't order food when we were ready because again she kept walking past us like we were invisible, It's funny cause I'm always the one needed to be rushed and to make a decision and I had enough time to make a decision and decide EXACTLY what I wanted! That never happens..lol anyway We were never offered refills on drinks that were refillable but she made sure to tell us which drinks weren't refillable! Our food finally arrived and it was warm, Our appetizers here hotter than the food! No wait I take that back the spiciness of the buffalo sauce was hotter than our food and that's just disappointing,our fires were lukewarm. I was not impressed at all! it actually made me mad! At the end of it all we took two bites an packed everything up, My older children ate their tenders thank god and my youngest had a burnt dry burger! SMH!!!  It looKed as if none on the staff last night was over 25 and if they were they sure didn't act like it and they seems to be playing and chatting a lot! There was even a random guy over behind the counters in a red,blue and white hoodie I may be off about the colors but anyway he was over there chomping away at food and standing near ours! I was unsure if he was a worker that was off for the night or if he was a friend of a worker that was getting off soon but it was very unsanitary an awkward. I feel like i wasted so much money there last night. I barely are anything! I went home hungry. I must say though even though our server didn't deserve a tip I left her one and I also left het a nice note on the napkin under her tip that "THE SERVICE HERE SUCKS" Honest and truthful  Will not be getting our business again!!!!!!

Went here on a sort-of date once. Everything was great.  There were a lot of people so we ended up sitting at the bar. The bartender was witty and jovial. The drinks were reasonable. The kitchen was a little slow but we shared an appetizer that was good but forgettable.  Like I said, everything was great....until they charred my burger. I tried to eat some of it, thinking maybe it was just blackened. Nope charred. It was inedible and ended up having to send it back. The bartender was really apologetic and I wasn't charged for it. Other than that hiccup this place is alright.

I used to love Red Robin for its yummy burgers.  Although I could never get them to prepare a burger any less than about medium-well, the beef was usually juicy and flavorful enough that I could forgive. I usually also ended up with a doggie bag. Well, no more. They have switched to nearly McDonald's thin, prefab, frozen patties. Service was great on a busy Saturday, so I can't fault them there. The product has fallen down several notches, however.

Took my son and his friend here after his high school farewell. I sat at the bar and the service was great. The boys sat at the table and enjoyed themselves also. The greeter was very polite. We were seated quickly even though it was crowded. I would return to this location.

Want to start off by saying Red Robin is more of a 3. But a couple of factors made me bump it up to a 4.  -I tend to drink a lot of water while I eat, and my waitress never missed a beat on getting me a new glass of water, even though she was busy with other tables as well.  -The O's game and Towson University football game was on when I went, and we were seated with great views to see both. (O's won btw) -The other times I went to Red Robin we had a group of 12+. The waitress was more than happy to split the check for us individually. One time our group was too busy eating and talking that no one mentioned separate checks, but our waitress had the foresight to do so. You can read about the food on other reviews. They are known for their burgers and have a good variety of them, but I just wanted to highlight some of the customer service and the other bits that make this establishment so great.

Love Red Robin, but service today was certainly not up to par. Several appetizers were brought to our table incomplete. We were not thrilled by the live music courtesy of Red Robins finest expo line cleaners (see video attached). The young lady was apparently removing frozen sauce. Our entrees were brought to the table lukewarm and my sisters wrap was served cold (later told all wraps are prepared and served cold) and her side of broccoli was raw. The children's food was overcooked (photo's attached). Above all, our server, Erin was phenomenal!! It's a shame that she was failed by her team to provide a great quality of service.

Just here, ordered a burger well done. It was burnt to a crisp. How incompetent must you be to burn a hamburger??? Really! The table had some disgusting stuff on it when they sat us down. It got on my arm, I cleaned it up with a napkin and went to wash off. The bathroom was a complete mess, one toilet was clogged and it stunk like skunk feces wrapped in Limburger cheese. The glasses had a gross film on them and the plates were not cleaned properly. Have fun getting sick eating here, this is the last time I will ever attempt to eat here again.
I love their cream of crab soup. It's my go too place when i can't figure out where to go. The sports bar has great sandwich prices and great service.

Reeeeeeeed Robin UMMMMMMM!  I've been divulging in there towering onion rings and bottomless lemonades for years!  I've pretty much tried every burger on the menu but the A1 Peppercorn burger and the Bleu Ribbon burger are must haves! They bring it to you with the burger already wrapped and ready to eat- which is great for kids (and adults----ME!) who have a hard time with big burgers... My nephew LOVES this place, i was actually surprised that he could eat an adult sized milk shake, his burger AND fries in one sitting! And he's 7! lol It was remarkable I tell you! I usually eat about half my burger there with my fries... And order another set for later. Which leads me to the bottomless fries--- another bonus... (You can also ask for a set of fries to go- if you sprinkle a little obay seasoning on them and pop em in the oven for about 10 minutes, theyre as good as new! I could go on and on.... Wait, I'm gonna make you go and try it on your own! Then, you let me know how it went :-) P.S.: The root beer float is HUGE!

I was going to rate 3 stars, but decided it needed to be dropped down to 2 ... more on that in a bit. Ironically, I don't like many of the burgers here.  They all look 100% better in the beautiful images they post in their adds and on their menus. When I get a burger, it looks nothing like the pictures I was fooled with, and the taste is never anything earth shattering. I'll just stick to 5 Guys for burgers intermixed with occasional late night runs for a double whopper with cheese @ BK. Now (again ironically) here is what I love about red Robin - their fish & chips is FABULOUS. Some of the best fish & chips I've found about town. I take the family to RR on occasion knowing I can always get my fish & chips and I'll be happy. I also just learned about the bottomless fries, and they have decent fries here ... we  just ask for more fries *immediately* after the server delivers our food, again after 5-10 minutes, whether we're ready for more or not, and again before we leave when I replenish along with half the fish & chips I saved for the journey home. Good way to squeeze out a little more value. Now as to why only 2 stars ... every time we come here, we are waiting 10-15 minutes on average while we are looking at a restaurant with 10-15 clean, open tables right in the middle of the place. If I owned this place, I'd be going  nuts thinking about the lost revenue while people turn and walk out because they can't seem to get seated at one of the dozen or more open tables ... and we've seen many people do this. That is RED-ROBIN-REDEICULOUS. EGREGIOUS!! FIX IT RED ROBIN!

Usually go to this Red Robin with friends and have enjoyed it in the past but lately this particular Red Robin seems to get worse with every visit.  The servers seem to  care less and take much longer than before. Also, the last time I went I ordered the grilled chicken sandwhich as I always do, except this time it was burnt. It was even more aggravating that the waitress we had took a long time to get us everything from start to finish.  I hope they improve on these issues soon.

The waiter (Jonathan) was awesome. The food was not hot (fries/burger were cold), the first round of drinks were terrible. The strawberries used were spoiled? As though it were frozen, thawed and left out on a counter way too long. Pretty horrid. We sent them back and I got a blood orange margarita that was better.

So...I had never been to Red Robin, ever.  Yes, I'm a good 7 years late on the notice.  I finally made my debut at Red Robin today. For a Saturday at noon, Red Robin was packed like a can of Bumble Bee Tuna stuck in vegetable oil.  Luckily for me, there was no one sitting at the bar, which I where I sat.  I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ Burger which came with a side of golden steak fries.  The burger, while being edible, seemed to be lukewarm in temperature.  A couple of the previous reviews for Red Robin pretty much points out this same thing.  Nonetheless, I did my best to digest the burger. I did come away with a souvenir: a bottle of Red Robin seasoning which was $3.  I'll put that seasoning to use this summer with them burgers smoking on the grill.  Not a bad deal considering seasoning in the market can reach way more than $3. Not bad for my first time at Red Robin.  The restaurant, from previous observations, gets packed during the weekends so take notice.  Not a bad spot to come to in order to get a quick burger and some steak fries.
I've been super Red Robin in Towson quite a few times. In experiences,  my rather it's take out or eat in the food is always cold

Red Robin is OK if you're out in the 'burbs and can't get to a good restaurant.  Decent food quality.  Above most chains I would say.  Nothing particularly special on the menu though.  Standard fare done fairly well.  Cheap.

Ughhhhhhh. I. Am. So. Full. Which is to be expected when you go to dinner at a restaurant with bottomless steak fries. Once you get past the potatoes, Red Robin is a whole lotta burger. All types. All kinda. All good. Quick. Easy. Fast. Only a 3-starer for me though, because it was kind of a stressful dining experience, despite the friendly staff and quick food. It was packed! I'm talking line out the door, tons of kids, lots of noise, and people everywhere kind of packed. I went at 6:30 on a Sunday night, so maybe a lot of people had the same idea, but I have a feeling it's probably a pretty busy restaurant all the time. There aren't very many other restaurants in the area, so everyone seems to flock here.
Really slow service, the restaurant was not busy. I got my beverage ten minutes after I got my food. I will not be visiting this location again.
